alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior York; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 9:05PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect northwestern York... southwestern Oxford...west central Cumberland...northwestern Strafford...southeastern Grafton...Belknap...northeastern Merrimack and Carroll Counties... At 905 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from Conway to near Ossipee to near Grafton...and moving southeast AT 40 MPH. Locations impacted include... Laconia, Conway, Franklin, Fryeburg, Alfred, Moultonborough, Ossipee, Meredith, Plymouth, Sanford, Grafton, Farmington, Lebanon, Loudon, Alton, Barnstead, Canaan, Gilmanton, Canterbury and Holderness. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 51 and 78. This also includes... Lake Winnipesaukee, Squam Lake, Burnt Meadow Mountains, Peary Mountain, and Douglas Mountain. * Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your location. If traveling pull off to a safe location. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior York; Southern Oxford
